message.content:
Step 1: Calculate the Operating Cash Flow to Net Income Ratio  
• From the cash flow statement, the Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities = –650630.22  
• From the income statement, Net Profit = 905750.76  
• Ratio = (–650630.22) / 905750.76 ≈ –0.7189, which we round to –0.72  

Step 2: Calculate the Current Assets Turnover Ratio  
• Use the average current assets because we have beginning and ending balances.  
• Beginning Total Current Assets = 8000000.00  
• Ending Total Current Assets = 9625738.03  
• Average Current Assets = (8000000.00 + 9625738.03) / 2 = 8812869.02  
• From the income statement, Total Revenue = 2869560.42  
• Ratio = Total Revenue / Average Current Assets ≈ 2869560.42 / 8812869.02 ≈ 0.3258, which rounds to 0.33  

Step 3: Calculate the Quick Ratio  
• Quick Assets = Total Current Assets – Inventory  
• Ending Total Current Assets = 9625738.03  
• Ending Inventory = 112000.00  
• Quick Assets = 9625738.03 – 112000.00 = 9513738.03  
• Total Current Liabilities = 628478.02  
• Quick Ratio = Quick Assets / Total Current Liabilities ≈ 9513738.03 / 628478.02 ≈ 15.147, which rounds to 15.15  

Final Answer in JSON format:
------------------------------------------------

{"solution": {"Operating Cash Flow to Net Income Ratio": "-0.72", "Current Assets Turnover Ratio": "0.33", "Quick Ratio": "15.15"}}
